text_line: Yul from the Seo family.
Do not come back here ever again.
If we meet again, I will kill you.
Wait-- I could not stop her from leaving.
I could not ask her why.
The moment she sliced my sincerity in half, I could no longer cherish our memories together.
It became a secret that I had to bury within my heart.
You are up early. Why are you out here?
Why… did you come here?
I caught a bird. I will cook it for you.
I do not enjoy eating.
I will be cooking rice with chestnuts.
The chestnuts here are very sweet.
Danhyanggok has very sweet chestnuts.
I do not enjoy sweet things.
You could have just declined.
Given your power, you could have killed me just now.
Do not overreact.
While it is true I pushed you away, it was with no intention to kill.
So you did push me away.
Do not bother to prepare breakfast.
I will leave once Dang-gu wakes up.
Be my guest if you do not wish to eat.
Why are you still here?
I will eat before I go.
Prepare some food for me.
I thought you did not wish to eat.
I never said that.
Do not put words in my mouth.
Since you were drunk yesterday, I thought you would still be hungover.
I only declined because I did not want to burden you.
I understand.
In that case, -I should rinse some more rice.
Where is it?
I will do it.
Have you cooked rice before?
I have not, but I can do it as long as you teach me.
It is quite simple.
Rinse it in water, then pour in a decent amount of water, and cook it on high heat.
Then let it sit for some time.
It is pretty simple.
You said you could do it if I taught you.
You said it was simple.
I was wrong. I am sorry.
Jeez. Look at this.
It is all burnt.
Let me make it up to you.
How about those vegetables?
Teach me how to chop them.
Jeez, what a waste of rice.
Goodness.
Dang-gu.
Hey.
You should bathe here before you go.
The mineral water makes your skin soft.
Have some breakfast too.
Right.
Mu-deok and Yul are making breakfast together.
Together?
Yes.
Yul is cooking rice with Mu-deok.
Goodness.
I told you to cut the green onions into big pieces.
This big?
No.
Do you not understand what "big pieces" mean?
Big pieces.
Big pieces…
You are wrong.
Those are too small.
Like this.
Big pieces. Like this.
You should have elaborated more.
How was I to know when all you said was "big pieces"?
I thought you were the best mage of Jeongjingak.
How could you not differentiate what is big from small?
Forget it.
Pour a bowl of water into that soup.
Wait…
Which bowl are you talking about?
This one?
Or do you mean this one?
That one.
Why does it look like Mu-deok is scolding him?
Are you sure she likes him?
That is the type of girl she is.
She does not easily like or feel shy in front of others.
Goodness. Look at Yul.
He is still learning well despite being scolded.
Learning?
Look.
I said that was enough.
I do not enjoy salty food.
Jeez.
He was never like that
Taste it yourself.
in front of Master Heo or my uncle.
This is interesting.
Does he not look like an intimidated pupil?
It is bland, right?
See? You should have stopped when I told you to.
I am sorry.
A cute master and her diligent pupil.
That is enough. It needs to boil down.
A master and her pupil?
Let it sit.
Why were you so stubborn when this was your first time cooking?
All right.
Let me see how well you taught him and how well you learned from her.
Let me have a taste.
It is tasty.
Tasty?
I seasoned it just as Mu-deok told me to.
Well done.
You must have been elated to be complimented by your master.
I thought I was good at everything since people called me a genius.
But I learned that there are things I am not good at.
Mu-deok.
Thank you for helping me realize this.
It was frustrating since he could not understand me at all.
But he was determined to keep learning.
That is why I kept teaching him.
Look at you exaggerating.
Is this a royal meal or something?
There are things you can learn from preparing a meal.
You should learn as well.
Sadly, I do not have a great master like he does.
I am sorry, but the rice is a bit burnt.
I see.
You can learn how to do it again.
Mu-deok, do you think Yul can do better next time around?
He is not completely hopeless.
Thank you for your words.
Why are you washing them alone?
Ask your wonderful pupil to help you.
He prepared the meal, so I ought to clean up.
Were you happy to teach him?
Do you want him to be your pupil?
It would have been easier had he been my pupil.
He is diligent and obedient.
He is not lazy or reckless like you.
Master, do not cheat on me.
What?
I get that you like him since he is diligent and obedient.
But I am your one and only pupil.
A master should not have multiple pupils and vice versa.
Are you upset because I taught Yul how to cook?
Yes, I am. How could you teach someone else when your pupil is standing right in front of you?
If you are going to teach someone how to cook, it should be me.
Teaching someone else is betrayal and cheating.
I can try to understand the betrayal part.
But cheating?
I am speechless.
I am certain that I sensed cheating.
What was that?
What is it this time?
Mu-deok, do not cheat on me.
It hurts and upsets me.
I did not know my pupil was this possessive.
Fine. My one and only pupil will be you who spews nonsense first thing in the morning. Happy?
But--
Mu-deok!
Mu-deok!
Young Master.
Would I be cheating if I addressed others as Young Masters and answered their calls?
That cannot be helped.
But when you address them, be a bit indifferent.
How ridiculous.
Young Master Park! I am coming!
Mu-deok, you are hurting my feelings.
I told you to be indifferent.
That is one tall tree.
Yul, was this the tree you wanted to see?
I think so.
I cannot believe it really exists.
How did you know that I was injured?
There is a really tall tree nearby.
I can see the entirety of Danhyanggok from up there.
You can see the entirety of Danhyanggok from up there.
Does that mean you have climbed up that tree before, Mu-deok?
That was just my guess since the tree was so tall.
Then do you want to climb it?
Should I help you get up there?
Dang-gu, you cannot climb that tree.
You need to have mastered at least Chisu to go up there.
Is that so?
Should I try?
Yes.
Maybe you could do it.
Mu-deok, go with him.
Do you want to go up there?
No, thank you.
I do not want to climb such a special tree with just anyone.
"Just anyone"?
I guess she is too afraid to go up there.
Let us go.
I examined the core of his energy.
He was a commoner, not a mage.
I am certain that there are more victims.
There is a soul shifter among us.
What should we do, Master Lee?
Locating the origin of this sorcery is direr than catching the soul shifter.
I suspect Cheonbugwan.
This soul shifter who had entered Songrim recently was a constellation recorder mage there.
Also, the one who killed Naksu, who died while soul shifting, and destroyed all traces of her men was Assistant Gwanju Jin Mu.
Naksu…
We identified him with the possessions he had.
Who was he?
He was a low-ranking servant from Cheonbugwan.
What? Cheonbugwan was involved once again.
I will confront Jin Mu right now.
Follow me.
Yeom!
Yes?
Do not do anything.
You used to ruin everything due to your recklessness back in the day.
You may have aged now, but your temper remains.
I am sorry, Master Lee.
It is not the time yet.
We must observe Cheonbugwan discreetly.
Jin.
You have grown up well.
You used to wear a diaper and roam around.
I cannot believe you are all grown up and leading your people.
Master Lee.
Who is he?
He was the pupil of Master Seo Gyeong, the founder of Songrim.
But he is so young.
He is not.
I still remember singing… at his 100th birthday party.
I even danced.
Is this dog Gwigu?
So it was you who took Gwigu from Jinyowon.
He will find the soul shifter.
Naksu was the one who died while soul shifting, right?
Yes, Master Lee.
She was a notorious assassin who was talented in spells.
Was it Naksu's soul that I sensed?
The one who has Jang Gang's sword -is his son, Jang Uk, right?
Yes.
Have you seen him before?
I met a boy with a binding bracelet and his maid who followed him around.
It was interesting.
Mu-deok packed us some chestnuts.
Yes, they are sweet.
Give some to Maidservant Kim as well.
Sure.
Why did you bring your father's sword?
Oh, that? Mu-deok brought it.
You are not going to train, so why did you bring this precious sword?
Should I give it to Maidservant Kim?
You… are not his son.
Do as you wish.
Let us go.
Sure.
Did you say you came here often to pick herbs?
Have you ever encountered someone who lived here?
No, Young Master Seo.
Who would live in a place like this?
I see.
One more thing.
Did it get pretty cold during the winter?
Why do you ask?
I never came here during the winter.
I worried whenever it started snowing.
I worried if it was too cold or if things were all right amid the snow.
It is actually warmer than you think.
The snow quickly melts in the sunny spots.
Is that so? I am relieved.
There is a variety of food to eat during the winter and many places to take refuge from the snow.
I bet this will be tasty.
They are really sweet.
Should we stay a day more?
Mu-deok must really like him.
She does not like him.
I am telling you. She does.
Look.
She does not look at us the same way she looks at him.
The wind keeps blowing.
Is it coming from her?
Dang-gu, let us go.
All right.
Goodbye, Mu-deok.
Let us go.
I will see them off.
Bye.
Bye.
Try to remember where you had lost your Spirit Plaque.
I will.
Lie low.
The Unanimous Assembly was summoned because of you.
I guess all 12 of my former masters attended it.
They were all so heartless to their former pupil.
They even mentioned cutting off your energy flow.
Why would they say that?
What?
Because you avoided your duel by fleeing.
But it is a ridiculous duel.
And you did not want it either.
Nobody is expecting you to come to that duel.
So just stay here and be laid-back like always.
The leader wanted to know something.
He asked if you were doing as you were told.
You are the result of your mother's love affair.
But we cannot allow you to lead Cheonbugwan after your father.
So stop dreaming of becoming… like your father.
Just stay a clueless Young Master of the Jang family.
Can I tell him that you are?
Have I ever listened to anyone?
Tell him I am doing the very opposite and being reckless.
Dang-gu, leave that here.
Why?
I want to help Mu-deok catch a pheasant.
Goodbye.
Did we hurt his pride?
Let him be.
We cannot ask him to come and meet a dignified death.
So you retrieved the sword you threw away.
It hurt my pride to hear that I was a laughingstock.
In that case, let us train as if your life depended on it.
You seem happy to hear that your pupil became a laughingstock.
Since we are on the topic, let me add more motivation.
Your friends did not ask you to return home with them.
Had they been in your shoes, they would have fought to their deaths.
But they told you to hide and run away.
Can you guess why?
That is because you are worthless.
Your tongue is sharp like a sword.
You do not hesitate to cut me with your words. How merciless.
I would not hesitate to stab you with a sword if that could get you back on your feet.
Yes, Master.
Keep stabbing your worthless pupil.
Why are you not motivated after what I said?
Why are you dispirited?
Your spiteful words demotivated me.
I need to bathe and cool myself down.
Why does he bathe so much in one day?
You worthless and lazy scumbag.
I hope you burn yourself in hot water!
Unbelievable. What kind of a master says such a thing to her pupil?
Did Uk not know how he lost his Spirit Plaque?
Maybe someone sold it after he had dropped it, and that is how those men got hold of it.
I heard there was a place where they sold such plaques.
Keep tracking his Spirit Plaque.
Yes, my lord.
Yes, my lord.
How… is Uk doing?
He is doing well. He fishes and drinks.
He has yet to unfasten the binding bracelet.
You may go.
It is not that heavy anymore.
It does not hinder my movement either.
Some mages train with an iron rod to strengthen their arms to better wield their swords.
You were unknowingly strengthening yourself by wearing that heavy bracelet all day.
It was not intentional, but you found yourself an excellent training tool.
You are extraordinarily lucky.
If I take this off, I will be faster and stronger.
But if you fail to control yourself, you will become even more reckless.
I…
Never mind.
What did you and Yul talk about?
About Danhyanggok.
He asked how it was during the winter.
You have met Naksu when you were young?
I was still unsure after seeing her body.
But going to Danhyanggok helped me confirm it.
That is why I am telling you now.
Danhyanggok is a deep and dangerous valley.
A young girl cannot possibly survive there on her own.
It seemed like she was living in hiding.
After she learned of my name and my family, I was not able to see her again.
That must mean she recognized your name.
Tell me everything you know about her.
There is nothing.
I do not know her name or age.
Other than the cliff where we called out for birds, I have never been to her abode.
There is one thing.
She once mentioned her father.
My father wrote down the stars.
I did not think much of it back then.
But writing down the stars is what a constellation recorder from Cheonbugwan does.
My lord.
Among their constellation recorder mages, do any of them have a grudge against us?
A constellation recorder from Cheonbugwan?
A mage?
Twenty years ago, there was one constellation recorder mage who died in the hands of the four families.
His entire family lost their lives that day.
Except for one member.
His one and only daughter disappeared.
So our family was involved in her father's death.
She must have been hostile toward you because your family was involved in her father's death.
Is there anything else that you remember?
This was a very long time ago.
I do not remember anything else.
Because I missed them.
The broken leg did not bother me.
And I was not scared to get scolded.
I liked them a lot.
I saw you using that to summon your bird a few times.
I would also like to try.
Can I have that?
The Crown Prince is powerful.
There is only one way my pupil can subdue him and stay alive.
Tansu.
What do you want me to do?
Slice through the water drops as they fall.
They are not raindrops.
Even someone unskilled as you can slice through such slow-moving water drops.
Go on.
Only three drops in one breath.
That does not matter.
Tansu, the skill you will master, will only require you to slice one.
Tansu?
Look here.
I understand that I am a quick study, but mastering Tansu is pushing it.
I guess having 12 masters in the past has taught you something.
That is correct.
You can only learn that skill once you have mastered Chisu.
You barely mastered Ryusu, yet you are still struggling to control your energy.
A subpar pupil like you cannot learn it.
But?
But that is the only way for you to fight against the Crown Prince and come out alive.
Tansu is swordsmanship that involves flicking energy with your sword.
Your right arm may lack the skills, but it has become stronger thanks to the binding bracelet.
Just one drop.
Hit one waterdrop so you can gather and flick your energy.
You will not master it that quickly.
Let us eat and resume.
Tansu?
He will never master that skill.
That is not a relationship of a maid and her young master but that of a master and her pupil.
Mu-deok.
So you are training him.
I see he was studying Tansu.
Where did you learn that?
Young Master Jang is quite knowledgeable thanks to his former 12 masters.
Is he trying to run before learning to walk?
He has a long way to go.
In any case, he should try.
His next step could lead him to his death.
Is your young master aware of that?
Why did you not dodge it?
Seriously.
That is the result of forcing your energy to come out.
Your arm could burst if this continues.
It looks like it could rot.
Then you will have to cut it off.
Are you serious?
If the rotten energy spreads throughout your body, you could die.
The heat has subsided. You are fine.
Rest up. That is the best remedy.
What a liar.
Everything he said was true, right?
But then again, whether I die of poison, flogging, being stabbed, or my hand exploding, this merciless master does not worry about her pupil.
That is right.
It is because you are extremely lucky and worthy.
Lying is becoming second nature to you.
I am just not trying to dispirit you.
I see. Thank you, my cruel master.
But stay away when I am holding a sword from now on.
You almost got stabbed back there.
I only stood still because I wanted you to control it.
I was not trying to hinder you.
You were not hindering me.
I am just worried about you.
Think of me as a mother bird who is worried about her egg cracking.
Can you even relate?
Whatever. What you did barely made me crack.
I could have dodged it.
It was not dangerous?
How could you have dodged it when I was so fast?
You were not that fast.
You little…
Could not dodge that, could you?
You attacked without warning!
Really? Then I will warn you.
Mu-deok, your eyes.
Jeez…
You bastard.
I cannot believe you fell for that again.
Do that again.
From this up close?
Really?
Try me.
Mu-deok.
The blue marks are barely visible now.
They were quite pretty.
And you should not provoke me when we are this close.
Do you not think I would do something else from this distance?
I guess you understood what I meant.
Maybe there are things I can teach you in this field.
Jang Uk.
You must think I am naive for having lived alone here.
Well, I guess.
I will have you know I can teach you in other ways too.
Such as?
Hey! You…
A truly skilled individual attacks when their enemy least expects it.
Keep that in mind, my pupil.
Unlike me, you poked me really hard!
Mu-deok.
Hey. Mu-deok.
Is that a new concubine?
He does not even bother to follow the formalities anymore.
She is from a small family of mages from the east.
A comet brushed past the Big Dipper the day she was born.
At this rate, he will summon every woman born with strange horoscopes.
He just wants the King's Star.
When the late king ascended the throne, it was prophesized that the next king would have the energy of the King's Star.
The people of Daeho were delighted.
However, your father who had an ordinary horoscope ascended the throne next.
And you are no different either.
So people started talking.
The divination was incorrect.
Gwanju Jang Gang fled after giving such a ridiculous divination.
Your father believes in it.
That is why you are afraid.
I am not afraid.
You are afraid that someone with that energy will appear or that your father may have a son like that.
I am aware of that.
Your duel against Jang Uk is around the corner.
Eliminate the son of that man who gave such a terrifying divination.
You must get rid of your fears when you can.
Do you think he will even show up that day?
I heard he fled.
Rumor has it that he is even contemplating marriage to avoid it.
Marriage?
I heard he is marrying into the Jin family so he can earn the Jin family's plaque.
Uk and Cho-yeon are getting married?
Did they not break off their engagement before?
That is why it is easier to prepare for it.
She still had the marriage gifts from last time.
I see.
After the marriage ceremony, Jang Uk…
I mean, my husband will move in here.
But my current room is too small for both of us.
Can we use the big room in the east instead?
But that is your sister's room.
It is the best room we have.
It is such a waste to keep it vacant for over a decade.
It was never vacant.
Bu-yeon will return.
I am sorry, Mother.
Your father is looking for her.
Your sister will return home soon.
Bring me the yin-and-yang jade from Jinyowon.
The yin-and-yang jade?
You have been wanting that.
They say when you and your lover wear rings made of that jade, your love for each other deepens.
Craft your wedding rings with it.
Thank you, Mother.
What an annoying pot.
It was you, was it not?
How annoying.
I guess it annoys you that I am getting married.
But wait and see.
I will become even more annoying once I wear a ring made of this jade.
Eat up.
All right.
I had brought home a pheasant earlier.
So why are there only greens?
It is inside-- It is in the soup.
The pheasant was so tiny.
There was not much left after making that broth.
I do get a very faint taste of it.
I overheard this while selling herbs in Songrim.
Two prominent families will be marrying off their kids.
Who will be getting married?
Lady Jin's daughter is getting married.
Cho-yeon is getting married? To whom?
To the son of Cheonbugwan's Gwanju.
Is that not you?
I was never told I was getting married.
What is going on?
What is up Maidservant Kim's sleeve?
Most hastened weddings tend to be shotgun weddings.
That is not true.
You were previously engaged to her.
Maybe you could not control yourself.
How could she be pregnant when we were never this close?
Right. You are all talk.
What?
Then why did you refuse the chaste herb tea?
That is because…
I have plans to marry later on.
You must want to get married one day.
Yes, I do.
I truly want to.
I will get married at all costs.
Wait up.
Why did you want to see me?
When will the mother-of-pearl cabinet that I ordered from Songrim come?
It is for Uk and me.
The trade from the south will arrive in two weeks.
That will be too late.
I should have ordered sooner.
Forget about the mother-of-pearl cabinet.
You should inform Uk first.
He has no idea about this.
That is why I have written a letter to him.
Read it and share your thoughts.
Sure.
It is fragrant.
This is a perfume that incurs the feeling of love.
A treasure of Jinyowon.
Gosh, it is very fragrant.
Why are you sniffing it?
Stop that!
Hold your nostrils shut!
I almost wasted the precious perfume.
Please give this to him.
And make sure there are no women around him when he opens it.
I will.
What are you doing?
Uk's hand size is similar to yours, right?
Why do you ask?
Come with me to get our wedding rings.
Lend me your hand.
Why would I go there with you?
Go with your groom.
Marriage should only happen when both sides agree to it.
I pity you for being like this.
Why?
Do you think I am getting ahead of myself?
Do you think he will break it off again?
Whether you are getting ahead of yourself or not, I will help you.
Just make sure it pans out.
And I will lend you my hand.
Come to think of it, Maidservant Kim was against the idea of me living with the wife's family the last time we discussed marriage with Cho-yeon.
There is only one reason why this is being discussed again.
She wants to save me.
She must have made a deal with the Jin family to avoid your duel with the Crown Prince.
She probably needed Lady Jin's help.
If that were the case, will you get married?
What should I do, Master?
Should I get married?
Can I?
If you do, we can no longer stay in Danghyanggok.
Right. I should return home.
Even still, we cannot have this relationship.
Why not? I can still keep you by my side as my maid.
I have no plans to stay by your side as just a maid.
You can go ahead alone.
I will be at Chwiseonru.
If you do not pick me up, I will go back alone.
CHWISEONRU
What is going on?
We are from Cheonbugwan.
We were told to escort you.
Let us go.
This is the Crown Prince's sachet.
I have His Royal Highness' protection.
You cannot touch me.
What are you doing? Let me go!
This is the Crown Prince's sachet.
We brought her from Chwiseonru like he wanted.
Chwiseonru?
The girl you wanted is here, Your Royal Highness.
Where?
Over here.
Her?
Lift your head up.
Why are you dressed like that?
I do not know.
She did this to me after I was dragged here.
Did you do that?
Is she not the gisaeng from Chwiseonru?
No, she is not.
She is Filthy Mu-deok.
Filthy?
Get out.
Go.
Look at you.
Why did you want to see me?
I had something to tell you, so I told them to get you.
But you are not Filthy Mu-deok right now.
Filth and silk do not go hand in hand.
Maybe in your dictionary, it does.
Did you just snap at me?
No, Your Royal Highness.
I am grateful that you dressed someone as filthy as me in silk.
All right. This new look… does not suit you.
Since you do not like it and I am uncomfortable in this, let me go get changed.
No.
It is all right. Just keep it on.
Tell me what you want, and I will do it.
Tell your young master not to show up that day.
I do not want to kill him and become enemies with Songrim or the Jang family.
It is best that he fled, and let us keep it that way.
So he just needs to be the laughingstock.
That is right.
If he becomes stubborn, dissuade him.
He will die if he fights me.
Tell him to stay hidden, then get married to the Jin family.
So it is true that getting married will save his life.
What will happen to you if he gets married?
Will you go with him?
No, I will not.
Why not? Did he refuse?
You were even willing to drink filthy chamber pot water for him.
He knows neither loyalty nor duty.
He does know a bit, Your Royal Highness.
Are you taking his side?
You were always bad-mouthing him.
I am sorry, Your Royal Highness.
It would please you if I bad-mouthed him.
But I have no energy to run my mouth right now.
You are a filthy mutt who will be abandoned by its owner.
Should I take you in?
I can do that.
There must be things you can do here too.
No, thank you.
I may be a filthy girl whom everyone avoids, but I refuse to serve just anyone.
Forget it. I do not want someone filthy by my side either.
You may leave.
Yes, Your Royal Highness.
I will go now, Your Royal Highness.
"Just anyone"?
But I am the Crown Prince.
Filthy Mu-deok does not know to whom she is speaking.
Be gentle. Take your time.
Yes, ma'am.
Maidservant Kim.
How have you been?
Young Master!
My dear Young Master!
Young Master!
Were you worried?
Have you been eating well?
Yes, I have. I have been well.
Goodness.
Your skin is radiating.
Oh, please.
Let us go inside.
Was she the one who tried to sell…
Songrim's Spirit Plaque?
It was not me. It was Mu-deok.
Mu-deok tried to sell Uk's Spirit Plaque?
I just introduced her to the seller.
In the end, Ae-hyang snatched it herself.
So Mu-deok and I are innocent.
What is this?
Why are you dressed like that?
It is a long story.
Have you returned to Chwiseonru?
Did Uk send you back since he is getting married?
No, Young Master Seo.
Even if that was the case, I would never come back here.
Ju-wol finally caved in and told me that you tried to sell Uk's Spirit Plaque.
Yes, I did.
Why?
Because I needed money.
I wanted to wear pretty clothes, have good food, and have fun at places like this.
Was that the case when you were drunk last time?
That is correct. I stole Young Master Jang's money and drank.
I am just so puzzled by you.
I cannot understand you.
You do not need to.
Just stay that way.
I am going inside.
Would you like to come with me?
That is all right.
Goodbye, then.
CHWISEONRU
The Spirit Plaque…
So it was you, Naksu.
Young Master.
Why do you not want to get married?
Do you dislike Young Lady Jin?
It is not that I dislike her.
I am just not interested.
You have feelings for someone else, do you not?
Who is it?
Do I know her?
No, you do not.
So there is one.
I knew it.
Who is she?
Well…
She is like a single bird egg on top of a tree.
I am the only one she has, so how could I possibly get married?
Those kinds of girls are the most dangerous!
Those who have nothing to brag about but are just clingy!
She is not like that.
Who is she? Tell me this instant.
I will take care of it.
Exactly how?
Once I give her a silk pouch full of money, she will crack out of her egg and fly away.
She cannot fly anywhere.
It is not that easy.
In any case, I cannot get married.
So take care of it for me.
You better take care of it, got that?
Young Master.
What is wrong? Are you hurt?
Let me see.
What happened to your arm?
Did it get out of control again?
Please sell that dress.
It is made of silk, so make it worth it.
All right.
Our madam is tending to a customer at the moment.
Young Lady Jin from Jinyowon is here.
She is looking for someone who can craft her wedding rings.
She is marrying a young master from Songrim.
Then how about this one?
These are the works of Daeho's best craftsmen?
They are stylish but a bit tacky.
Then may I see the yin-and-yang jade?
Seeing it for myself will help me give you better recommendations.
They say when you and your lover wear rings made of that, your love for each other deepens.
Why did the jade break?
It was fine when I took it with me.
I see. That is when it broke.
Mu-deok.
Young Lady Jin.
Why are you suddenly leaving?
That is Mu-deok. Is Uk here as well?
No.
I see.
Since they are attached at the hip, he must be somewhere in the fortress.
Attached at the hip?
As his maid, she is serving him.
Watch what you say.
Mu-deok is not just any ordinary maid to him.
He came by to pick Mu-deok up when she was drunk recently.
He adores her so much.
He even carried her on his back.
It is obvious that he picked her from the get-go because she won his heart.
Is Mu-deok from here? Was she a gisaeng?
She is one poor girl.
No wonder he cares about her so much.
Hey.
You know who I am, right?
Of course, I do.
You are Young Lady Jin from Jinyowon.
You will have to address me as "Lady" soon.
Because I will marry your young master soon.
Goodness. Congratulations, my lady.
As your master's wife, you will serve me too.
There is something you must do.
First, carry this.
What is this?
What was that?
A broken stone?
It is a precious object.
If it breaks or cracks, you will have to take responsibility.
Is she saying that when it is already broken?
Take that and follow me.
My lady.
You are not someone I must serve yet.
I must go to Young Master Jang now. Goodbye.
Is she looking down on me?
Was that real back there?
It is best that I do not cross paths with him.
Hey! You!
The dangerous man?
Or this mean brat?
My lady.
Give that to me. I will carry it.
Sure.
Make sure you do not break it.
So it is broken.
She is going to put the blame on me.
Is this the Jin family's abode?
Why are you not coming?
Mother.
You cannot leave like this.
Say that you will marry her in front of your late mother's portrait.
That is the only way to protect your father's position.
Maidservant Kim.
Do you think I really am my father's son?
Do you know who my real father is?
What do you mean?
You are Gwanju Jang Gang's son.
Yes. That is what I believed all my life.
I do not want to deny it now.
So…
I will not sit still.
Do not stop me no matter what I do.
Maidservant Kim, the Jin family sent someone.
From Jinyowon? What is it about?
Something happened there.
They want Young Master Jang to hurry over.
You were looking for me?
What is this about?
A precious treasure of ours has disappeared.
And an individual has disappeared with it.
So this is Jinyowon.
Hey.
So it is you.
It has been a long time.
You are saying Mu-deok -disappeared here?
Yes.
Your maid, Mu-deok, stole our yin-and-yang jade and ran away.
